item.description:
There is a free But Ticketed event at The New Haven Library on March 19th:

Korean Spirit & Culture Promotion Project presents
Treasures of Korean Art and Culture

The whole family is invited to learn more about the country
that was once known as the Land of the Morning Calm. This
presentation is designed to provide an overview of Korean
culture and history, and will include:

· two short documentaries about Korea, illustrating  the
artistic and cultural achievements of Korea's past, and
industrial achievements since the Korean War
· a traditional Korean meal
· a re-enactment of a traditional Korean wedding ceremony
· raffle for traditional lanterns and a copy of Taste of Korea:
Korean Cuisine Full of Wisdom and Nature

Advanced Registration is Required! And you should register for yourself.

You can try to register at http://tasteofkorea.eventbrite.com/search

When A.J. attempted to register it said Wait List, so we're not sure how that's going to work.  Emily got her own ticket though already, so you should not have problems if you get in.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Emily at the Event, she can be reached at 203-812-9243
item.name: A Taste of Korea
